Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we‚Äôre looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it‚Äôs designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you‚Äôll help clients unlock value from data.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we‚Äôd love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM‚Äôs or optimization.
You‚Äôve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You‚Äôre comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe‚Äôs leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A company car or mobility budget
Laptop, phone & phone subscription
A competitive salary and indefinite contract
Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

HTML:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we‚Äôre looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it‚Äôs designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you‚Äôll help clients unlock value from data.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we‚Äôd love to talk:

  • You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
  • You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
  • You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM‚Äôs or optimization.
  • You‚Äôve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
  • You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
  • You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
  • You‚Äôre comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
  • Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
  • You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.

What We Can Offer You

  • A key role in one of Europe‚Äôs leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
  • The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
  • A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
  • Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
  • A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
  • Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A company car or mobility budget
  • Laptop, phone & phone subscription
  • A competitive salary and indefinite contract
  • Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development

People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance AI Data Scientist. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the insurance sector is looking for an AI Data Scientist to join their team.




Responsibilities:

Work closely with the business and technical teams to identify high-impact use cases for Generative AI
Design, develop and implement AI driven solutions for business needs, using both internal and external data sources
Identify and communicate insights from data analysis to support decision-making and problem-solving activities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues
Continuously monitor AI models for accuracy, and proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies and drift
Contribute to the development of a GenAI capability framework and internal best practices




Is this you?

Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field or a related field with a strong focus on data analysis
Good knowledge of English, French and Dutch
Data science, preferably in a business setting
Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and communicate, business needs and requirements
Proven experience with data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Proficient in Python and commonly used libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit learn, etc.).
Cloud Expertise: Strong knowledge of cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI services, Azure ML, Vertex AI, Databricks, Azure OpenAI, etc.)
LLM Libraries: Deep expertise with Python libraries such as Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, and Autogen.
Deep understanding of LLMs fine tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops).
Gen AI Deployment: Proven experience in deploying and monitoring Gen AI models using CI/CD pipelines, Weight & Biases, and GitHub workflows.
Strong knowledge of data analysis techniques and tools, such as Python, SQL, PBI, DataBricks
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Manage multiple priorities
Meet tight deadlines
Availability for occasional travel and projects in other operating companies




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Developer | Freelance / FTE | Leuven (Hybrid)

We are seeking an AI Developer to join our client‚Äôs team, focusing on computer vision and image recognition solutions for global terminal automation. You will design, build, and optimize deep learning models to support their products.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize AI models for image and video analysis
Write and maintain production-ready code for AI-driven applications
Integrate AI solutions into existing software systems
Validate and test models to ensure scalability, performance, and reliability
Collaborate with R&D to explore and implement new AI concepts
Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge sharing

Experience

Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or related field
3+ years of hands-on experience in AI development
Strong programming skills in Python and C/C++
Analytical problem-solver with strong communication skills in Dutch and English




This is a role 2 days onsite, ASAP start and can offer a 6-month freelance contract or FTE position. Contact us for more information & Interview times!

Title: Data Science Manager AI
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch and English is required. (French is a plus)




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,‚Ä¶) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt machine learning modellen voor onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?

In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in een multidisciplinair team bestaande uit data science engineers, data analysten, bi engineers, business analysts, ‚Ä¶ Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt Laagste Prijs, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In de data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega‚Äôs aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologie√´n (bv: Polars, lightgbm, pytorch, uv, kedro, ruff). Daarnaast werken we ook met cutting edge in-house technologie zoals onze eigen forecast module of causaliteitsmodule. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten.
Het team focust op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun noden in analytische oplossingen die we bouwen in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met IT en business.
We zijn verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde cre√´ren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data √©n use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele effici√´ntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.







Profiel

Ervaring ‚Äì Je behaalde een master in handelsingenieur, computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde,... Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
Kennis statistische modellering ‚Äì Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van machine learning en statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt een goede kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen ‚Äì Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis ‚Äì Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Engels en een goede kennis van het Nederlands.







Wij bieden

Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden ‚Äì Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.




Bij Colruyt Group kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of technieker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Colruyt Group gelooft in de kracht van diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie. Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren bij Colruyt Group en we bieden iedereen gelijke kansen.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA‚Äôs Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve idee√´n uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‚Äòbusiness-as-usual‚Äô proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het ‚ÄúACA Innovation Lab‚Äù zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe idee√´n en technologie√´n af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, ‚Ä¶)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We‚Äôve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega‚Äôs gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

ACA‚Äôs Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve idee√´n uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.


Hoe wij (samen)werken?


Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‚Äòbusiness-as-usual‚Äô proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het ‚ÄúACA Innovation Lab‚Äù zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe idee√´n en technologie√´n af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.


Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?


  • Python & Java
  • Kubernetes & Kubeflow
  • AWS / GCP
  • Jupyter notebooks
  • Git
  • Tensorflow
  • Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, ‚Ä¶)
  • Wandb
  • MLFlow


Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?


Hard skills

  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
  • Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
  • Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.


Soft skills

  • Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
  • Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!


Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?


  • Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
  • Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
  • Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
  • We‚Äôve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega‚Äôs gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
  • Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
  • Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Machine Learning Engineer - Cloud Systems (GCP)




We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience deploying and scaling models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You‚Äôll work closely with engineering teams to implement and maintain cloud-based ML solutions that are secure, scalable, and aligned with business goals.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy ML models on GCP
Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using best practices

Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)

Title: BE-Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we?

Collaboration Betters The World ( CBTW ), is a company providing tech et business solutions to its clients, thanks to its expertise through 9 service lines.

As a Data Scientist, you will join our Data Analytics & AI service line, where we are supporting organizations every step of the way to become data-driven.

Responsibilities

What is your role?

You will be part of a journey where you will have two impacts: a client impact and an internal impact. For the internal impact, based on your skills and time, you will be joining our internal data community at CBTW, to share knowledge and best practices. For the client impact, tasks can vary depending on the client and the project, but as a Data Engineer, you will mainly:


Mining both structured and unstructured data to identify patterns and provide information through predictive models
Explore and collect data from multiple sources to apply or develop analytical ad statistical methods and machine learning models
Apply statistics and machine learning algorithms to discover patterns in datasets


Qualifications

What is your profile?

You


Have at least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, statistics, economics or in another relevant field
Have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role
Know technologies such as Python, Tensorflow, Pandas, Numpy SQL, Random Forest, neural networks, etc.
Speak English, Dutch and French
Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive Thinking, Collaboration, Evolution & Commitment.


What are we offering?

Evolution


Personal follow-up during your career at CBTW and buddy-ship program during your first 6 months
Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, O'reilly,‚Ä¶) and possibility to get certified every year (Azure, AWS, Prince2, etc.)


Collaboration


On top of the data community, you can join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers
International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide


On Top Of That


Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice between electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)
You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.


Do you see a match? We would love to see your application coming in! üòâ

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients. You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels. 02

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization‚Äôs infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer ( Worldwide Remote)




We're building a next-generation cloud platform with in-house agents at its core. If you're excited about real-world AI applications, love experimenting with LLMs, and want to help shape tools that feel truly intelligent, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




What you‚Äôll do:

Design, prototype, and deploy AI agents for internal and external use
Work with hosted LLMs and fine-tune models to perform complex tasks
Integrate agents into our cloud-based platform and continuously improve performance
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to bring ideas to life




Who you are:

You have hands-on experience with LLMs, vector databases, and frameworks like LangChain or similar
You're comfortable building MVPs and iterating fast
You care about product, not just models




What we offer:

Remote work, worldwide
Zero bureaucracy, fast decisions
A technical, product-focused environment
Real ownership of what you build

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Support the Biocartis organization by performing data analysis needed for product development (assays, instruments, manufacturing line‚Ä¶), QC release and on market support
Support assay development teams by developing decision trees that will be integrated in assay specific software
Support assay development teams (internal and partner) with assay specific script development and writing
Support the assay development teams with respect to scientific software tools and data management.




Accountabilities

Develops tools and methods to facilitate analysis of the data generated during:
Assay Development
Cartridge production (including raw materials and semi-finished products)
Instrument production
Field usage
Develops the decision tree that will be integrated in the assay specific software
Writes assay specific software for our Idylla platform (LUA scripting, xml) in support of new assay development requirements of R&D and IVD. This includes definition of methods and data treatment algorithms and documentation.
Performs data mining tasks, statistical analyses and assist other project team members with these tasks
Keeps abreast of latest developments in bioinformatics tools to ensure state-of-the-art environment
Works as a member of a team, is responsible for organizing own time and resources in an optimal fashion. Prioritizes assigned projects and manages time accordingly. Is able to handle more than one project simultaneously
Provides planning input and estimations for their work to support the assay PM (project planning), functional lead and Bio IT manager (resource planning)
Works autonomously as a Bio IT lead for projects
Identifies improvement projects to make sure that the Bio-IT knowledge and capabilities stay in line with the Biocartis roadmap
Supports yearly R&D budget submission in line with general guidelines received, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary
Coaches Data Scientists from technical and process point of view
Applies industrialization and GxP expertise to build robust and reliable assays
Independent review of Bio IT related activities in technical and design review meetings




Profile requirements

Master in Bio-Informatics or Master in other life sciences discipline, Informatics, Applied Mathematics with experience in computational biology or equivalent through training/experience.
Basic knowledge of :

-Risk analysis and mitigation

-Controlled development according to planning, work instructions and procedures

Expert knowledge of:

-SW Development Lifecycle: planning, requirements, design, implementation, verification

-Assay industrialization and GxP

-Validation

-Agile Scrum

Biocartis specific :

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Platform (Console, Instrument, Cartridge, Idylla SW eco sphere, ...)

-Profound knowledge of ASSW development (TTP, MessagePack, DT, Reporting, ...)

-Expert knowledge of Biocartis QMS & SW Development standards

Expert knowledge of:

-Data visualization (Spotfire is a plus)

-Statistics

-Machine learning (classification, regression, ‚Ä¶)

-Deep Learning

-Science skills (Electronics, software, mechanics, chemistry, physics, optics, thermodynamics, fluids)

Programming skills such as:

-Scripting (LUA, Python)

-Mathematical programming ( R )

-Data analysis

Basic knowledge of:

-SQL query

-non-relational databases (Big data) is a plus

-Molecular Biology

Good communication skills:
Communicates with persuasion: presents, explains and defends a complex message in a clear and concise way and persuades different stakeholders
Planning & organization:
Time & priority management: plans activities effectively with respect for priorities and deadlines
Analytical thinking:
Conducts ongoing in-depth analyzis to anticipate potential problems and guides others in complex issues
Adaptable to change:
Accepts and implements change and adapts, even in difficult situations
Resilient:
Continues to perform effectively under time pressure and in the face of disappointment, adversity and opposition
PC skills:
General

-Expert knowledge of Spotfire

-Expert knowledge of IBM Synergy & Change, git, Team Foundation Server (TFS)

-Basic knowledge of (S)LIMS

Biocartis specific:

-Profound knowledge of Idylla Studio Library

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Studio

Legislation and regulation: Expert knowledge of applicable IVD legislation and standards (IVD, IEC62305, ISO13485, ccfr21part810,‚Ä¶)
Languages: Fluent in English both written and spoken, knowledge of Dutch is a plus




Our offering

We offer you a challenging job in an exciting environment, working for top entrepreneurs in the biotech industry. You can be part of a very dynamic, young and growing team in a highly innovative environment. You will have freedom to shape your work and shape your job. Your input is highly appreciated. Of course we offer you a fitting compensation package including a Flexible Income Plan and we care about your Wellbeing.

Title: Python Engineer ‚Äì HFT ‚Äì fully remote - up to $150,000 Salary + Bonus
Description:
Your Python code could move millions in seconds.




Most Python roles are about building applications. This one is about building trading systems that make split-second decisions in global markets.




You‚Äôll be helping to power the next generation of trading infrastructure, designing and building scalable, high-performance microservices all within a fast-paced environment. The other aspects will be to work closely with the wider team, collaborating with traders and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.




There are lots of projects going on but your initial focus will be helping to expand the exchange connectivity by adding new markets, building Python-based microservices for trading operations and developing features for funding rate prediction.




You‚Äôre going to ideally be coming from a HFT background, with a minimum of 5 years of experience developing Python based microservices. The team is small and spread across Europe so you will need to be independent and be able to push projects through autonomously. Where a lot of HFT environments require you to be on-site almost every day, this one gives you flexibility of where you're based.




This a global high-frequency trading firm, specialising in crypto markets and leveraging cutting-edge technology to shape the future of trading on real-time. Starting salary is around $150k plus bonuses.




If you want your work to shape real-world trading decisions in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, get in touch.




No up to date CV required.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together!

Job Description

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!‚ÄØ

You are fully convinced that data science isn‚Äôt a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:


A master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer‚Äôs business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A company car or mobility budget
Laptop, phone & phone subscription
A competitive salary and indefinite contract
Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

HTML:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together!

Job Description

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!‚ÄØ

You are fully convinced that data science isn‚Äôt a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:

  • A master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
  • Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
  • Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
  • Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
  • Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
  • Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer‚Äôs business context and challenges.
  • You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
  • A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
  • You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.

What we can offer:

  • A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
  • The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
  • Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
  • A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
  • A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A company car or mobility budget
  • Laptop, phone & phone subscription
  • A competitive salary and indefinite contract
  • Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development

Title: AI-Engineer
Description:
LACO is een toonaangevend data-intelligentiebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar expertise in data engineering, analytics en AI. Wij helpen organisaties bij het omzetten van data in waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunen hen in hun digitale transformatie.




Wat ga je doen?

Als AI-Engineer ben jij de technische spil in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen op het Azure-platform. Je werkt nauw samen met data scientists, data engineers en softwareontwikkelaars om schaalbare en betrouwbare AI-modellen te bouwen, finetunen en integreren in de productie omgeving.




Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:

Het deployen van machine learning modellen via Azure Machine Learning.
Het ontwikkelen van pipelines voor data-inname, modeltraining en deployment (CI/CD).
Het monitoren, bijsturen en onderhouden van AI-oplossingen in productie.
Het toepassen van responsible AI-principes zoals fairness, explainability en privacy.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om AI-mogelijkheden om te zetten in waardevolle toepassingen.




Wat neem je mee?

üéì Vereiste vaardigheden en ervaring:

Bachelor of Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of vergelijkbaar.
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als AI-engineer of ML engineer.
Ervaring met Python en ML-frameworks zoals scikit-learn, TensorFlow of PyTorch.

Aantoonbare ervaring met Microsoft Azure, met name:

Azure Machine Learning (AML)
Azure Data Lake / Data Factory
Azure Cognitive Services
Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions
Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS) voor modeldeployment (pr√©)
Ervaring met MLOps-praktijken: versiebeheer, experimenttracking, pipeline-automatisering.
Begrip van CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker), en infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Bicep of Terraform).
Vaardigheid in het analyseren van modelprestaties en het doorvoeren van verbeteringen.
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat bieden wij?

Uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden door ervaren professionals.
Snelle groei binnen een expert-driven omgeving.
Een hecht team met regelmatige kennisdelingssessies en events.
Dynamische bedrijfscultuur: geniet van leuke evenementen zoals een familiedag, jaarlijkse skitrip, sportevents en game nights.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.




Interesse?

Klinkt dit als jouw volgende uitdaging? Stuur dan je cv naar careers@laco.be of solliciteer via onze website Working at LACO | LACO.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist for SEO
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist who can take large, unstructured SEO datasets and extract insights that drive rankings, traffic, and revenue. You‚Äôll work closely with our SEO strategists to identify opportunities, test hypotheses, and measure what actually moves the needle.

We're a strategy-first digital agency trusted by private equity firms and 8-figure ecom brands. We hire smart, self-managing people who want freedom, not babysitting. You‚Äôll own your outcomes, go deep into data, and help shape SEO strategy at a high level.

The Role

What You‚Äôll Own


Building data models that forecast SEO impact and ROI
Automating the analysis of rankings, traffic, and content performance
Identifying patterns across SERP behavior, competitors, and user intent
Creating dashboards that guide strategic SEO decisions
Running statistical tests to validate SEO experiments


Compensation & Next Steps


(contract, based on experience)
Part-time trial period (paid), then full-time contract
Fully remote, async teamwork from anywhere


Ideal Profile

Who You Are


2+ years working with SEO or digital marketing datasets
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, and data visualization (Looker, Power BI, or similar)
Experience with web scraping, APIs (Google Search Console, GA4), and NLP
Comfortable presenting technical findings to non-technical stakeholders
Bonus: Familiarity with content clustering, internal linking, and topical authority


What's on Offer?


Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
Excellent career development opportunities
Attractive salary & benefits
Show more

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
Are you a data scientist with a strong business mindset and expertise in Generative AI?

We are looking for a talented AI Data Scientist to design, implement, and deploy AI-driven solutions that solve high-impact business problems. In this role, you will work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, bridging technical insights with business needs.

Responsibilities


Work with business and technical teams to identify high-impact AI use cases.
Design, develop, and implement AI-driven solutions using internal and external data.
Analyze data and communicate actionable insights to support decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve data-related issues.
Monitor AI models for accuracy, proactively addressing discrepancies and model drift.
Contribute to the development of a Generative AI capability framework and internal best practices.



Profile of the Ideal Candidate


Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or related field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business).
5-8 years of relevant experience in data science, preferably in a business setting.
Strong business understanding and ability to communicate business requirements effectively.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage multiple priorities, and meet tight deadlines.
Availability for occasional travel or projects in other locations.



Technical and Business Skills


Proven experience with data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Proficient in Python and commonly used libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Expertise in cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI Services, Azure ML, Vertex AI, Databricks, Azure OpenAI).
Deep knowledge of LLM libraries (Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, Autogen).
Understanding of LLM fine-tuning/training lifecycle (LLMops).
Experience deploying and monitoring Gen AI models using CI/CD pipelines, GitHub workflows, and Weight & Biases.
Strong knowledge of data analysis tools (Python, SQL, Power BI, Databricks).



Why Join This Project?


Cutting-edge AI projects - work on innovative solutions that leverage Generative AI.
Dynamic environment - opportunities to grow your skills, influence business outcomes, and contribute to best practices.
Collaborative culture - join a team of passionate professionals driving AI adoption across the organization.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Data Scientist

Functiebeschrijving

In het AI&Analytics Solutions team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond brengen van onze processen/journeys door het opbouwen van een datas en experimentatiecultuur die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Heb je een passie voor het ontdekken van inzichten uit data en het omzetten hiervan in impactvolle oplossingen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te halen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist in ons team, zal je:


Nauw samenwerken met bedrijfsstakeholders om hun uitdagingen te begrijpen en te vertalen naar analytische problemen.
Machine learning, statistische methoden en optimalisatietechnieken toepassen om innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen die zakelijke impact hebben.
Voorspellende en prescriptieve modellen ontwerpen, bouwen en evalueren, en zorgen voor betrouwbaarheid en robuustheid.
Leiding nemen in de volledige lifecycle van ML-producten: van idee en prototyping tot implementatie en voortdurende evaluatie in productie.
Samenwerken met andere Data Scientists om kennis, best practices te delen en onze methodologie√´n continu te verbeteren.
Zorgen voor de kwaliteit en prestaties van je oplossingen door rigoureus testen en voortdurende monitoring na deployment.
Bijdragen aan onze data science community door herbruikbare assets te ontwikkelen, je expertise te delen en deel te nemen aan innovatie-initiatieven.


Profiel

Als Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Data Scientist heb je:


Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist/ML Engineer of een vergelijkbare analytische rol.
Een masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied (bijv. Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek, Data Science, Natuurkunde, Informatica).
Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch


En je bent ook:


Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.


AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden:‚ÄØCustomer first, Integrity, Courage‚ÄØen‚ÄØOne AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als √©√©n team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons‚ÄØDiversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten.‚ÄØ

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

  • Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
  • Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
  • Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
  • Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch

En je bent ook:

  • Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
  • Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
  • Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
  • Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
  • Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.

AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden:‚ÄØCustomer first, Integrity, Courage‚ÄØen‚ÄØOne AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als √©√©n team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons‚ÄØDiversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten.‚ÄØ

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

üî• Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



üéØ Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



üöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
