Title: Data Scientist
Description:
TFS HealthScience is a leading global mid-size Contract Research Organization (CRO) partnering with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies throughout their entire clinical development journey. Our expertise spans full-service solutions, resourcing, and Functional Service Provider (FSP) models.

About This Role

As part of our SRS/FSP team, you will be dedicated to one of our pharmaceutical partners. You will collaborate with their Real World Evidence and Observational Research group to design and implement advanced analyses of healthcare data.

This role is focused on the Respiratory therapeutic area, particularly COPD, with the objective of generating real-world insights that support strategic decision-making and improve patient outcomes.

Key Responsibilities


Deliver and implement advanced secondary analyses of EMR and claims data to support epidemiological observational studies.
Provide expert input and recommendations on study design, data partner selection, and Real-World Data (RWD) best practices.
Collaborate with internal and external teams to evaluate the strengths and limitations of RWD sources for respiratory research.
Develop, validate, and document analytical methods and models using SQL (required), R, and Python.
Contribute to study reports, publications, and presentations through high-quality statistical analyses and visualizations.


Qualifications

Required:


Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related Life Sciences discipline.
Demonstrated experience with large datasets, preferably healthcare data.
Proficiency in SQL.
Strong programming skills in R and Python.
Proven ability to work in cross-functional teams and communicate with both technical and non-technical colleagues.


Nice To Have


Hands-on experience with EMR/healthcare data, registries, and/or insurance claims databases
Familiarity with medical terminologies and clinical data standards (ICD-9/10, SNOMED).
Knowledge of the OMOP Common Data Model and related tools.
Prior experience analyzing COPD data.


What We Offer


Competitive compensation and benefits package.
Professional development opportunities in an international, collaborative environment.
A culture that values innovation, teamwork, and making a difference in patients‚Äô lives.


About TFS

Our journey began more than 25 years ago in Lund, Sweden. Today, TFS operates in 17 countries across Europe, North America, Asia-Pacific, and the Middle East, delivering tailored clinical development solutions to our partners.

Our core values ‚Äî Trust, Quality, Flexibility, and Passion ‚Äî define who we are and guide how we work. They are the foundation of our culture and our success.

#TogetherWeMakeADifference

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!


Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Part-Time) $60 ‚Äì $120/hr Remote EU
Description:
Data Science Expert

Part-Time | Remote | Hourly Contract

Compensation: $60‚Äì$120 per hour

Overview

An opportunity to contribute data science expertise to high-impact research collaborations with leading AI labs. This role focuses on improving AI systems through code validation, algorithm evaluation, prompt refinement, and model benchmarking. Professionals will directly influence the accuracy, reliability, and scalability of next-generation intelligent systems.

Key Responsibilities

Review and refine AI-generated prompts, responses, and code
Validate concepts for technical accuracy and reproducibility
Provide structured, rubric-based feedback on solution quality and clarity
Tag and organize content by topic, complexity, and domain
Support benchmarking efforts to assess model capabilities across tasks

Ideal Qualifications

3+ years of experience in data science, applied statistics, or machine learning (industry or research)
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related field (Bachelor‚Äôs minimum; advanced degree preferred)

Part-Time | Remote | Hourly Contract

Overview

An opportunity to contribute data science expertise to high-impact research collaborations with leading AI labs. This role focuses on improving AI systems through code validation, algorithm evaluation, prompt refinement, and model benchmarking. Professionals will directly influence the accuracy, reliability, and scalability of next-generation intelligent systems.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You‚Äôll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




üéâ What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




üíº What we‚Äôre looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! üéâ

Title: AI/Data Scientist Team Lead
Description:
Don‚Äôt settle for just any consulting company, choose the one that‚Äôs right for you!




We‚Äôre on the lookout for an AI/Data Scientist Team Lead to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.




As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.




You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn‚Äôt the job for you if you‚Äôre looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. üöÄ




As an AI/Data Scientist Team Lead, your mission would include:




Technical Leadership

Leading the technical aspects of data science projects, from conception to deployment.
Designing and implementing scalable data science solutions that integrate seamlessly with existing infrastructures.
Developing and optimizing machine learning models to drive actionable insights and automation.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to align technical solutions with strategic goals.
Taking ownership of projects, ensuring high-quality deliverables in an agile environment.
Engaging in proof-of-concept (PoC) projects and scaling them into production-ready solutions.
Working in cloud-based environments and following MLOps best practices.
Communicating insights and technical solutions effectively to diverse audiences.

People Leadership & Management

Managing and developing a team of data scientists, fostering both technical excellence and personal growth.
Acting as a coach and mentor: guiding team members in problem-solving, career development, and project ownership.
Leading performance reviews, setting individual objectives, and providing constructive feedback.
Supporting recruitment and onboarding of new team members, ensuring strong integration into the team culture.
Creating an inclusive, collaborative, and motivating environment where people thrive and contribute at their best.
Balancing workload allocation across projects, ensuring sustainable team capacity and delivery quality.
Serving as the main point of escalation within the data science team and ensuring alignment with business priorities.

You‚Äôre a step closer to joining our team if you bring:

Background:

Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, or a related technical field.
5+ years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI-driven projects.
Previous experience leading or mentoring a small team of data scientists (formal or informal).
Experience in diverse industries and solutions, demonstrating adaptability and problem-solving skills is considered as a plus.

Technical Skills:

Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms (AWS preferred; Azure is a plus).
Experience deploying ML models and following MLOps best practices.
Understanding of data engineering principles to support scalable AI solutions.
Ability to design and implement proof-of-concept (PoC) projects and scale them into production.

Soft Skills:

Empowering Leader: You know how to inspire and grow a team, balancing guidance with autonomy.
Coaching Mindset: You take pride in helping others develop their skills and careers.
Organised & Decisive: You manage priorities and make informed decisions under pressure.
Inclusive & Collaborative: You build a culture where diverse perspectives are valued.
Trusted Partner: You engage confidently with stakeholders and align your team‚Äôs work with business goals.
Accountable: You ensure both project outcomes and team well-being are delivered.

Practical Info:

Languages: English and French or Dutch
Start Date: ASAP




We know that finding the right job isn‚Äôt just about the role‚Äîit‚Äôs about what‚Äôs in it for you, too. While we‚Äôre a start-up, we‚Äôre big on taking care of our people right from day one.




Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at what we offer:

üí∞ A compensation package that keeps you motivated:

Competitive salary
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
30 days of paid time off
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Representation allowances
Hospitalization & dental insurance
Meal vouchers
Opportunity to earn company stock over time

üéØ A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:

Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Hybrid work model
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles üéÆ
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments üßò
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ‚òï

‚ú® And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!




Our Recruitment Process:

Quick intro call with our HR team (5min)
HR Interview (30min)
Case study & Technical Interview (1h)
Final Interview (30min)




How to apply?

You can apply right here on LinkedIn




If you‚Äôre passionate about what we do but aren‚Äôt sure you meet every single requirement, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.




Let‚Äôs build the future of AI & Data, together ü§ù




Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we‚Äôll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions ‚Äî and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI in clinical research? Join Clario as an AI Engineer, where your expertise in machine learning, generative AI, and software engineering will drive transformative solutions across the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries. You‚Äôll be at the forefront of innovation‚Äîdesigning intelligent systems, fine-tuning large language models, and building scalable AI services that directly impact patient outcomes worldwide.




What We Offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support, and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working options
Full technology setup and support




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Design and develop AI-powered software solutions using GenAI and machine learning frameworks
Build and optimize data processing pipelines for model training and evaluation
Train and fine-tune AI models, including LLMs, for real-world applications
Implement testing strategies and performance benchmarks to ensure model reliability
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI initiatives with business goals
Stay current with emerging trends in GenAI, AI research, and software development
Engage with scientific literature and contribute to innovation across the organization
Support internal teams by resolving technical issues and sharing best practices
Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or related field (Bachelor‚Äôs with relevant experience also considered)
Minimum 3 years of experience in software development
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch)
Experience training, validating, and deploying AI models; LLM fine-tuning is a plus
Familiarity with AWS and Agile development environments
Creative problem-solving mindset and ability to adapt to changing priorities
Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail and commitment to quality




Why Clario?

At Clario, we put people first‚Äîalways. United by our mission to improve patient outcomes, we‚Äôre committed to transforming clinical trials through cutting-edge technology. We value every contribution and foster a culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning.

Are you ready to shape the future of AI in clinical research? Join Clario as an AI Engineer, where your expertise in machine learning, generative AI, and software engineering will drive transformative solutions across the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries. You‚Äôll be at the forefront of innovation‚Äîdesigning intelligent systems, fine-tuning large language models, and building scalable AI services that directly impact patient outcomes worldwide.


What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation
  • Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support, and well-being)
  • Remote or hybrid working options
  • Full technology setup and support


What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI initiatives with business goals

  • Support internal teams by resolving technical issues and sharing best practices

Our client is reimagining industry operations with AI-driven technology, enabling faster decision-making and intelligent insights. Their platform streamlines data access and automates evaluations, reducing review times from weeks to minutes.




The Role

Experience with NLP techniques, Knowledge Graphs, and RAG preferred

Growth opportunities in a fast-growing company

Mission-driven work improving industry efficiency

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Remote role in the EU (must have pre-existing working rights in the relevant country)




Our client is a fast-growing PropTech start-up redefining how people rent and manage property. The company operate in a number of major international locations and have built a reputation for delivering flexible, furnished rental solutions.




Alongside a reimagined tenant experience, the business also supports landlords with guaranteed rent schemes and full-service property management. With strong growth across the UK, Europe, and beyond, they are now investing heavily in technology to cement their place as a category leader.




They are hiring an AI Engineer to spearhead the adoption of artificial intelligence across the business. This role will involve building and deploying AI tools that power pricing, operational efficiency, automation, and customer experience, helping to scale the platform globally.

It‚Äôs a chance to work on real-world applications of AI in PropTech and play a part in transforming one of the world‚Äôs most important industries.




Responsibilities:

Create and integrate LLM / language model‚Äìbased features into core systems and user-facing tools.
Develop and train models for a variety of workstreams within the company.
Identify repetitive processes and deploy AI to streamline workflows, improve accuracy, and enhance service.
Deploy AI models in production using modern MLOps and cloud infrastructure.
Partner closely with product, engineering, and operations teams to create impactful use cases.
Maintain, document, and continuously refine AI pipelines for scale and reliability.




Requirements:

Ideally, a relevant degree in Computer Science / STEM / relevant area.
Clear commercial experience working on end-to-end LLM based solutions. This could be from a long-term internship through to a few years of full-time commercial work.
Python & FastAPI experience.
Ideally, AWS experience.




If this role interests you and you would like to find out more (or find out about other roles), please apply here or contact us via niall.wharton@Xcede.com (feel free to include a CV for review).

Title: AI engineer
Description:
Permanent contract position




WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Retail & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

- 1/3 of Personal development

- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence

- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :)




WHAT IS AN AI ENGINEER AT CREAM?

As an AI Engineer, you will have a central role in designing, building and deploying advanced AI solutions. You will work at the intersection of business needs and cutting-edge AI technologies, collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to turn complex challenges into smart, efficient solutions.




YOUR TASKS:

Develop end-to-end AI use cases, from business understanding to solution deployment.
Quickly prototype AI-driven scenarios and user-facing features.
Engineer effective prompts to optimize AI agent behavior and performance.
Collaborate closely with design, product and development teams
Design, develop and implement AI solutions using Azure OpenAI and other Azure services to translate business needs into technical AI solutions.
Integrate Azure AI services seamlessly into existing systems and enterprise environments.
Leverage your creativity and expertise to design intelligent solutions that combine data, AI and business requirements.
Document clearly all code, processes, architectures and workflows to ensure maintainability.
Participate actively in code reviews, knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement initiatives.
Apply best practices in software development, security, compliance, scalability, and performance optimization such as Devops CI/CD for AI projects.
Stay up to date with AI and machine learning trends, experiment with emerging techniques, and incorporate relevant advancements into your projects.
Contribute to use case definition in a co-creation mode with business and product stakeholders.




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You hold at least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields (Master‚Äôs degree is preferred).
You have minimum 3 years of professional experience in Data Engineering, AI or related disciplines.
You have strong hands-on experience with Agentic AI frameworks (OpenAI Agent SDK, MCP Tools, etc.).
You have preferably strong knowledge of Devops practices and CI/CD OR eagerness to learn.
You are proficient in Azure AI services and their integration into real-world business solutions.
You have a solid programming background (Python, Azure ML Services, API integration, etc.).
You are fluent in English AND in French or Dutch; passive understanding of the other language is a strong asset.
You have excellent analytical, communication and problem-solving skills.
You enjoy working in a collaborative, fast-moving environment where innovation and pragmatism meet.

Bonus:

You have the Microsoft Azure AI engineer associate certificate.




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Data Science Lead, Research Analytics
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Science Lead, Research Analytics who is creative, curious, and collaborative in our Global Data Science & Analytics team, based in our Brussel office in Belgium OR Slough.




About The Role

As a Data Science Lead in Research Analytics, you‚Äôll drive analytics solutions that inform compound and antibody discovery for early drug platforms. You‚Äôll apply data science and machine learning to diverse datasets‚Äîimaging, gene expression, high-throughput screens, and sequencing (e.g., mRNA display)‚Äîto identify initial hits and establish early structure-activity relationships. Your work supports the organization‚Äôs Digital Business Transformation and spans modalities including small molecules, peptides, biologics, and gene therapy. You‚Äôll collaborate across departments and with external partners, capturing insights for meta-analysis and communicating results within interdisciplinary teams.




Who You‚Äôll Work With

Internally, you will collaborate with relevant stakeholders in function areas such as Discovery Biology, Translational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Protein Sciences and fellow data science teams & IT. Externally, you may work with academic institutions and partner with other biotech or technology companies.




What You‚Äôll Do

Lead platform development of novel modalities such as peptides, impacting therapeutic projects with data-driven insights using analytics and machine learning on high-dimensional datasets conducted with complex biological assays (e.g. next-generation sequencing, cell-based assays, time-series assays, high-content assays, *-omics assays, etc.).
Clear communication of outputs & results from analyses for all relevant stakeholders.
Adapt and design data processes to support the capture and analysis of assay data and metadata and elevate platform data capability.
Develop workflows that can be used by team members for routine data processing and analysis.
Active collaboration with relevant stakeholders in function areas such as Discovery Biology, Translational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Protein Sciences and fellow data science teams & IT.




Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills

PhD in biological, chemical, or data science with strong skills & experience in informatics, statistics, or computer science and demonstrated delivery in the life sciences space
8+ years of hands-on experience with data types, file formats, and common metadata used in biology, including high-dimensional experiments such as imaging, or high-throughput experiments such as peptide/biologics display.
8+ of experience with machine learning on large / high dimensional datasets including data manipulation, wrangling, and analytics.
8+ Experience with machine learning on chemical, sequence, and/or biological features.
8+ years of experience with R and/or Python




Preferred

Prior experience in pharmaceutical industry
Experience with programmatic querying of relational or graph databases is desirable (SQL, neo4j, etc.)
Excellent written and oral communication skills demonstrated by publications and conference presentations




Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equal opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. UCB invites you to voluntarily self-identify during the application process. Provision of self-identification information is entirely voluntary and a decision to provide or not provide such information will not have any effect on your application for employment, your employment with UCB, or otherwise subject you to any adverse treatment. Any information you provide will be considered confidential and will be kept separate from your application and/or personnel file and will only be used in accordance with applicable laws, orders, and regulations.




Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on US-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com for application to US based roles. Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization‚Äôs infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
Show more

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization‚Äôs infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
  • Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
  • Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
  • Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
  • Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
  • Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
  • Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
  • Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.

Requirements

Education

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.

Technical Expertise

  • Strong proficiency in Python.
  • Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
  • Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
  • Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
  • Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
  • Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.

Soft Skills

  • Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
  • Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
  • Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Language Proficiency

  • Fluent in English (spoken and written).
  • Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.

Why Joining Us?

  • You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
  • A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
  • You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
  • You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Title: Expert in AI/NLP/ML
HTML:
ACT DIGITAL



Job Description

WORKING METHODS, ENVIRONMENT AND CONDITIONS

Project duration: 550 days

Initial contract duration: 150 days

Expected start date: 01/10/2025

Service delivery mode: Near-Site/Hybrid in Brussels

CERTIFICATIONS & STANDARDS:

Following certificates & standards are mandatory for the performance of tasks:

‚Ä¢ Certifications in Data Science and Machine Learning, especially related to AI/ML with Python.

SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of the tasks:

‚Ä¢ Experience (at least 10 years) in Solution Architecture and System Design for large-scale IT projects, ideally in EU organisations;

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of Data Science and Machine Learning principles;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of AI frameworks such as Haystack, Langchain, etc.;

‚Ä¢ Expertise in software requirements engineering, with an ability to translate complex stakeholder requirements into solutions and detailed technical specifications;

‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, along with experience in using development tools like GIT, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, etc.;

‚Ä¢ Knowledgeable in standard web technologies like API driven architecture, Single Page Application, Backend-for-Frontend, etc.;

‚Ä¢ Experience with database management systems (PostgreSQL, etc.) and search engines (Elastic Search, etc.);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of quality procedures and their application in the software development life cycle;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of information systems governance;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of cloud technologies.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:

‚Ä¢ Very good knowledge of AI/ML technologies

‚Ä¢ Ability to follow the fast pace of emerging technologies and solutions esp. in the gen AI domain

‚Ä¢ Ability to establish high-level vision regarding the architectural landscape

‚Ä¢ Strong analysis and problem solving skills

‚Ä¢ Capability to write clear and structured technical documents

‚Ä¢ Good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences

‚Ä¢ Ability to give business and technical presentations

‚Ä¢ Ability to participate and lead technical meetings

DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS

The following is a non-exhaustive list of tasks that will be performed by the external service provider:

‚Ä¢ Support the GAIA Programme team in the context of application architecture and system design;

‚Ä¢ Define & maintain an architectural vision & goverview of the GAIA landscape and registry of design related artefacts;

‚Ä¢ Analyse gen AI architecture for consistency, completeness, accuracy and reasonableness;

‚Ä¢ Oversee, monitor and report on vendor and contractor technical implementation activities in the GAIA Programme;

‚Ä¢ Establish quality control mechanisms and implement actions to maintain architectural consistency across the GAIA application landscape;

‚Ä¢ Coordinate the architectural discussions with other Commission stakeholders in the GAIA Programme;

‚Ä¢ Contribute with architectural advice to Commission projects that make use of the GAIA horizontal solutions;



Qualifications

A minimum educational qualification for lot 3 is: Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master‚Äôs level or 5 years of higher education.

Title: Innovation Officer (H/F/X) NL
Description:
Met bijna 4.000 medewerkers en een uitgebreid onderwijsnetwerk behoort de Stad Brussel tot de grootste werkgevers van het Brussels Gewest. Vastberaden om zich op de toekomst te richten, streeft zij er niet alleen naar een slimme en duurzame stad te worden, maar ook een proactieve rol op te nemen tegenover de grote uitdagingen van onze tijd.

In dit kader speelt de Directie Strategie en Digitale Transformatie een centrale rol. Zij stuurt de uitwerking en de opvolging van de algemene strategie van de Stad, co√∂rdineert de structurele projecten en leidt de programma‚Äôs voor digitale transformatie met het oog op de opbouw van een slimme stad die steunt op datagebruik.

Om deze ambitie te versterken, heeft de Stad beslist haar Dienst Strategie uit te rusten met een innovatieteam. Gedurende de komende drie jaar zal dit team de opdracht hebben zich te richten op twee complexe, transversale en prioritaire uitdagingen voor Brussel. Het zal worden aangemoedigd om nieuwe werkmethodes en benaderingen van publieke innovatie uit te testen.

Dit initiatief beoogt een dubbele doelstelling: de levenskwaliteit van de Brusselaars concreet verbeteren √©n innovatieve praktijken, eenmaal bewezen, duurzaam te verankeren binnen de administratie, om zo haar modernisering en aanpassingsvermogen te ondersteunen.

This position is part of City of Brussels participation in the Bloomberg Philanthropies Innovation team (i-team) program. Charged with helping city officials and civic partners design and implement solutions that meet pressing local challenges, the i-team will expertly deploy data, collect insight, and collaborate across sectors‚Äîcrowding the energy and resources across City of Brussels‚Äîto develop resident-centered interventions that improve people‚Äôs lives. The i-team will receive technical assistance from regional and global specialists, and benefit from learnings from peers in city halls across the region and around the world. To date, the Bloomberg Philanthropies i-team initiative has reached over 100 cities across 16 countries and four continents‚Äîrepresenting more than 100 million residents‚Äîand inspired hundreds of other local governments to embrace innovation systems and practices.







Functie

Je leidt en stimuleert het werk van het innovatieteam rond twee stedelijke uitdagingen

:Chrono-urbanisme (10-minutenstad): concentratie van voorzieningen in multifunctionele wijkclusters en beter gebruik van bestaande infrastructuur
.Leegstaande/verlaten woningen: aanpak van obstakels rond kleine wooneenheden (eengezinswoningen, kleine appartementen, woningen boven winkels)

.Je zorgt voor strategisch en operationeel leiderschap, co√∂rdineert de samenwerking tussen diensten en partners en garandeert dat de acties tastbare resultaten opleveren voor de inwoners. Je bent ook het aanspreekpunt voor de Europese i-teams en Bloomberg Philanthropies, en draagt bij aan een cultuurverandering die innovatie structureel in de werking van de Stad verankert.

Taken

Uitdagingen aanpakken

Co√∂rdineren van de uitvoering van de projecten en afstemmen op de strategische ambities
Mobiliseren van interne en externe stakeholders
Waken over doelstellingen, budget en deadlines; superviseren van deliverables

Leiderschap & strategie

Samen met de collega van het i-team de innovatiestrategie mee bepalen
Een cultuur van experimenteren en samenwerking installeren
Structurele hefbomen identificeren om innovatie duurzaam te verankeren

Institutioneel & partnerschappen

De Stad vertegenwoordigen in het Europese i-teams-netwerk en bij Bloomberg
Strategische communicatie verzekeren met Burgemeester en topmanagement
Rapporten opstellen (Engels) en het administratieve en financi√´le beheer opvolgen

Methodologie & betrokkenheid

Ontwerpen en begeleiden van workshops, co-creatie en collectieve intelligentie
Projectlessen vertalen naar beleid, processen en tools
Studies, analyses en aanbestedingen initi√´ren of opvolgen

Profiel

Competenties

Ruime ervaring in beheer van complexe, transversale projecten, idealiter in een publieke context
Aantoonbaar leiderschap, capaciteit om multidisciplinaire teams te inspireren
Ervaring met publieke innovatie, organisatieverandering of beleidsdesign
Inzicht in stedelijke dynamieken en interesse in duurzaamheid en burgerparticipatie

Kwaliteiten

Sterk analytisch en synthetisch vermogen, resultaatgericht
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden (NL/FR/EN)
Politiek inzicht, diplomatie en wendbaarheid in een meerpartijenomgeving
Systemische visie, creatieve en innovatieve ingesteldheid

Troeven

Grondige kennis van de Brusselse administratie
Ervaring met internationale programma‚Äôs, subsidies of innovatienetwerken
Kennis chrono-urbanisme, burgerparticipatie of stedelijke innovatie
Certificaat projectmanagement (PMP, Prince2, Agile)




Vereist diploma

Je bent houder van een Masterdiploma

Of je voldoet aan de voorwaarden voor interne mobiliteit voor een functie van niveau A of voor promotie naar een functie in de graad van bestuurssecretaris

.Indien je je diploma behaald hebt in het buitenland, is op enkele uitzonderingen na, een gelijkwaardigheidserkenning door NARIC-Vlaanderen nodig (https://www.vlaanderen.be/gelijkwaardigheidserkenning-van-een-buitenlands-diploma-of-getuigschrift-in-vlaanderen)

Aanbod




Een voltijds contract dat verbonden is aan de looptijd van de subsidies (1/11/2025 tot en met 31/10/20
27)Bruto maandelijks salaris: minimum 3.913,31 euro's (dat kan hoger zijn afhankelijk van de waardering van eerdere werkervaringen, familiale situatie en het slagen voor de taalexamens). Je kunt een schatting van jouw salaris krijgen via via onze online loonsimulator
Een tweetaligheidspremie (onder voorbehoud van het behalen van het onderzoek van Selor artikel 8 en artikel 9¬ß2)
Eindejaarspremie en vakantieg
Maaltijdcheques (8 euro‚Äôs, waarvan 6,91 euro‚Äôs ten laste van de Stad Brussel)
Geniet van 36,5 dagen betaald verlof, 4 dagen vastgesteld verlof door de Stad en 10 wettelijke feestdagen
Mogelijkheid tot een voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en dekking van het remgeld door de Stad voor medische zorg, voor u en uw gezin in het UZ Brugmann, UMC Sint-Pieter, Institut Jules Bordet en Koningin Fabiola Kinderziekenhuis
Pensioenplan voor contractuele medewerkers ter waarde van 3% van het bruto salaris
De meeste van onze administratieve functies zijn hybride met de mogelijkheid tot telewerken na 6 maanden, gekoppeld aan een forfaitaire tussenkomst van 20 euro per maand.
De Stad Brussel voldoet aan jouw behoeften op het gebied van professionele ontwikkeling door regelmatige trainingen aan te bieden (aan te passen indien nodig).
Onze werkplekken zijn gemakkelijk bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer en het MIVB-abonnement wordt 100% terugbetaald, er is ook een tussenkomst in de vervoerskosten (NMBS, De Lijn, TEC, fiets).




SELECTIEPROCEDURES

Stuur ons je kandidatuur uiterlijk tegen 21/09/2025 (curriculum vitae + motivatiebrief + kopie van het vereiste diploma). Onvolledige kandidaturen (zonder alle vereiste documenten) worden niet in aanmerking genomen. Een eerste selectie gebeurt op basis van het cv en de motivatiebrief. Kandidaten die overeenkomen met het profiel worden telefonisch uitgenodigd voor geautomatiseerde selectietests en voor twee selectiegesprekken. Deze zullen plaatsvinden voor een selectiecommissie en zullen betrekking hebben op motivatie, gedragscompetenties en technische competenties. Demos Helsinki (onafhankelijke denktank) zal deelnemen aan deze gesprekken. Door te solliciteren aanvaard je dat je persoonsgegevens uitsluitend en strikt in het kader van deze selectieprocedure met hun consultants worden gedeeld.

De Stad Brussel selecteert kandidaten op basis van hun competenties en maakt geen onderscheid naar leeftijd, geslacht, etnische afkomst, overtuiging, handicap of nationaliteit. We moedigen personen met een handicap aan om te solliciteren. We houden rekening met eventuele noodzakelijke aanpassingen, zowel in de selectieprocedure als bij de integratie binnen de administratie.

Show more
HTML:
Met bijna 4.000 medewerkers en een uitgebreid onderwijsnetwerk behoort de Stad Brussel tot de grootste werkgevers van het Brussels Gewest. Vastberaden om zich op de toekomst te richten, streeft zij er niet alleen naar een slimme en duurzame stad te worden, maar ook een proactieve rol op te nemen tegenover de grote uitdagingen van onze tijd.

In dit kader speelt de Directie Strategie en Digitale Transformatie een centrale rol. Zij stuurt de uitwerking en de opvolging van de algemene strategie van de Stad, co√∂rdineert de structurele projecten en leidt de programma‚Äôs voor digitale transformatie met het oog op de opbouw van een slimme stad die steunt op datagebruik.

Om deze ambitie te versterken, heeft de Stad beslist haar Dienst Strategie uit te rusten met een innovatieteam. Gedurende de komende drie jaar zal dit team de opdracht hebben zich te richten op twee complexe, transversale en prioritaire uitdagingen voor Brussel. Het zal worden aangemoedigd om nieuwe werkmethodes en benaderingen van publieke innovatie uit te testen.

Dit initiatief beoogt een dubbele doelstelling: de levenskwaliteit van de Brusselaars concreet verbeteren √©n innovatieve praktijken, eenmaal bewezen, duurzaam te verankeren binnen de administratie, om zo haar modernisering en aanpassingsvermogen te ondersteunen.

This position is part of City of Brussels participation in the Bloomberg Philanthropies Innovation team (i-team) program. Charged with helping city officials and civic partners design and implement solutions that meet pressing local challenges, the i-team will expertly deploy data, collect insight, and collaborate across sectors‚Äîcrowding the energy and resources across City of Brussels‚Äîto develop resident-centered interventions that improve people‚Äôs lives. The i-team will receive technical assistance from regional and global specialists, and benefit from learnings from peers in city halls across the region and around the world. To date, the Bloomberg Philanthropies i-team initiative has reached over 100 cities across 16 countries and four continents‚Äîrepresenting more than 100 million residents‚Äîand inspired hundreds of other local governments to embrace innovation systems and practices.



Functie

Je leidt en stimuleert het werk van het innovatieteam rond twee stedelijke uitdagingen

  1. :Chrono-urbanisme (10-minutenstad): concentratie van voorzieningen in multifunctionele wijkclusters en beter gebruik van bestaande infrastructuur
  2. .Leegstaande/verlaten woningen: aanpak van obstakels rond kleine wooneenheden (eengezinswoningen, kleine appartementen, woningen boven winkels)

.Je zorgt voor strategisch en operationeel leiderschap, co√∂rdineert de samenwerking tussen diensten en partners en garandeert dat de acties tastbare resultaten opleveren voor de inwoners. Je bent ook het aanspreekpunt voor de Europese i-teams en Bloomberg Philanthropies, en draagt bij aan een cultuurverandering die innovatie structureel in de werking van de Stad verankert.

Taken

Uitdagingen aanpakken

  • Co√∂rdineren van de uitvoering van de projecten en afstemmen op de strategische ambities
  • Mobiliseren van interne en externe stakeholders
  • Waken over doelstellingen, budget en deadlines; superviseren van deliverables

Leiderschap & strategie

  • Samen met de collega van het i-team de innovatiestrategie mee bepalen
  • Een cultuur van experimenteren en samenwerking installeren
  • Structurele hefbomen identificeren om innovatie duurzaam te verankeren

Institutioneel & partnerschappen

  • De Stad vertegenwoordigen in het Europese i-teams-netwerk en bij Bloomberg
  • Strategische communicatie verzekeren met Burgemeester en topmanagement
  • Rapporten opstellen (Engels) en het administratieve en financi√´le beheer opvolgen

Methodologie & betrokkenheid

  • Ontwerpen en begeleiden van workshops, co-creatie en collectieve intelligentie
  • Projectlessen vertalen naar beleid, processen en tools
  • Studies, analyses en aanbestedingen initi√´ren of opvolgen

Profiel

Competenties

  • Ruime ervaring in beheer van complexe, transversale projecten, idealiter in een publieke context
  • Aantoonbaar leiderschap, capaciteit om multidisciplinaire teams te inspireren
  • Ervaring met publieke innovatie, organisatieverandering of beleidsdesign
  • Inzicht in stedelijke dynamieken en interesse in duurzaamheid en burgerparticipatie

Kwaliteiten

  • Sterk analytisch en synthetisch vermogen, resultaatgericht
  • Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden (NL/FR/EN)
  • Politiek inzicht, diplomatie en wendbaarheid in een meerpartijenomgeving
  • Systemische visie, creatieve en innovatieve ingesteldheid

Troeven

  • Grondige kennis van de Brusselse administratie
  • Ervaring met internationale programma‚Äôs, subsidies of innovatienetwerken
  • Kennis chrono-urbanisme, burgerparticipatie of stedelijke innovatie
  • Certificaat projectmanagement (PMP, Prince2, Agile)


Vereist diploma

  • Je bent houder van een Masterdiploma

Of je voldoet aan de voorwaarden voor interne mobiliteit voor een functie van niveau A of voor promotie naar een functie in de graad van bestuurssecretaris

.Indien je je diploma behaald hebt in het buitenland, is op enkele uitzonderingen na, een gelijkwaardigheidserkenning door NARIC-Vlaanderen nodig (https://www.vlaanderen.be/gelijkwaardigheidserkenning-van-een-buitenlands-diploma-of-getuigschrift-in-vlaanderen)

Aanbod


  • Een voltijds contract dat verbonden is aan de looptijd van de subsidies (1/11/2025 tot en met 31/10/20
  • 27)Bruto maandelijks salaris: minimum 3.913,31 euro's (dat kan hoger zijn afhankelijk van de waardering van eerdere werkervaringen, familiale situatie en het slagen voor de taalexamens). Je kunt een schatting van jouw salaris krijgen via via onze online loonsimulator
  • Een tweetaligheidspremie (onder voorbehoud van het behalen van het onderzoek van Selor artikel 8 en artikel 9¬ß2)
  • Eindejaarspremie en vakantieg
  • Maaltijdcheques (8 euro‚Äôs, waarvan 6,91 euro‚Äôs ten laste van de Stad Brussel)
  • Geniet van 36,5 dagen betaald verlof, 4 dagen vastgesteld verlof door de Stad en 10 wettelijke feestdagen
  • Mogelijkheid tot een voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en dekking van het remgeld door de Stad voor medische zorg, voor u en uw gezin in het UZ Brugmann, UMC Sint-Pieter, Institut Jules Bordet en Koningin Fabiola Kinderziekenhuis
  • Pensioenplan voor contractuele medewerkers ter waarde van 3% van het bruto salaris
  • De meeste van onze administratieve functies zijn hybride met de mogelijkheid tot telewerken na 6 maanden, gekoppeld aan een forfaitaire tussenkomst van 20 euro per maand.
  • De Stad Brussel voldoet aan jouw behoeften op het gebied van professionele ontwikkeling door regelmatige trainingen aan te bieden (aan te passen indien nodig).
  • Onze werkplekken zijn gemakkelijk bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer en het MIVB-abonnement wordt 100% terugbetaald, er is ook een tussenkomst in de vervoerskosten (NMBS, De Lijn, TEC, fiets).

Onvolledige kandidaturen (zonder alle vereiste documenten) worden niet in aanmerking genomen. Een eerste selectie gebeurt op basis van het cv en de motivatiebrief. Kandidaten die overeenkomen met het profiel worden telefonisch uitgenodigd voor geautomatiseerde selectietests en voor twee selectiegesprekken. Deze zullen plaatsvinden voor een selectiecommissie en zullen betrekking hebben op motivatie, gedragscompetenties en technische competenties. Demos Helsinki (onafhankelijke denktank) zal deelnemen aan deze gesprekken. Door te solliciteren aanvaard je dat je persoonsgegevens uitsluitend en strikt in het kader van deze selectieprocedure met hun consultants worden gedeeld.

De Stad Brussel selecteert kandidaten op basis van hun competenties en maakt geen onderscheid naar leeftijd, geslacht, etnische afkomst, overtuiging, handicap of nationaliteit. Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist (Freelance) - 5 Months - Brussels




At RELYzIT Talent, we don‚Äôt recruit ‚Äî we build. We unite the top 2% of builders ‚Äî engineers, architects, creators ‚Äî into a movement across Europe and the GCC. Vetted through our VECTOR7‚Ñ¢ Signal Stack, you‚Äôre not just hired, you‚Äôre chosen. This is more than work. This is where builders build the future.




About the Role

We‚Äôre seeking a Senior AI Data Scientist to join our client‚Äôs high-impact project in Brussels. This is a freelance opportunity for five months, where you‚Äôll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to drive innovation through a hackathon and subsequent solution development. Your expertise will directly shape the future of AI-driven products and services, making a tangible impact on business outcomes.




Why This Role Matters

As an AI Data Scientist, you‚Äôll be at the heart of a mission-critical initiative: transforming complex data into actionable intelligence and robust AI solutions. Your work will empower our client to unlock new value, ensure data integrity, and deliver advanced analytics that drive strategic decisions. The stakes are high ‚Äî your contributions will define the success of a flagship AI project, setting new standards for excellence and innovation.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Optimize and tune databases and queries for maximum performance and reliability.
Analyze and map data flows and streams, ensuring seamless integration and data quality.
Develop, train, and deploy AI/ML models, leveraging advanced machine learning algorithms and frameworks.
Profile data, identify anomalies, address missing values, and implement robust data validation processes.
Present complex analytical findings through clear visualizations, reports, and presentations tailored to diverse audiences.
Collaborate within a multidisciplinary team, contributing to hackathon ideation and solution development.
Utilize scripting languages (Shell, Perl, Python) to automate data processes and support model development.
Manage code and model versioning using GIT or similar repositories.
Apply deep learning and generative AI techniques, including NLP, to solve real-world business challenges.
Ensure the successful deployment of ML solutions into production environments.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

5+ years of demonstrable experience in optimizing/tuning databases and queries (SQL, Oracle).
5+ years of experience analyzing data streams and flows.
5+ years of experience developing and training AI/ML models.
Deep knowledge of machine learning algorithms, frameworks, and statistics/probability theory.
3+ years of experience in data profiling, anomaly detection, and data validation.
3+ years of experience presenting analytical findings through visualizations and reports.
3+ years of experience with deep learning, generative AI, and NLP applications.
3+ years of experience with GIT (or similar) and model versioning.
3+ years of experience deploying ML solutions into production.
3+ years of experience working in multidisciplinary teams.
Strong scripting skills in Shell, Perl, and Python.
Demonstrable experience with reporting and communicating insights.
Ownership mindset, problem-solving drive, and a passion for building impactful solutions.

Technical Skills

SQL, Oracle
Shell, Perl, Python
Machine Learning algorithms and frameworks
Deep Learning, Generative AI, NLP
GIT or other code repositories
Data profiling, validation, and anomaly detection
Reporting and data visualization tools

Language Proficiency

Fluency in Dutch at European CEFR level C2 is required.

Other Requirements

Available for a freelance contract from 29/09/2025 to 28/02/2026.
Based in Brussels or able to work on-site as required.
Ready to be vetted through RELYzIT Talent‚Äôs VECTOR7‚Ñ¢ Signal Stack, joining the top 2% of builders in Europe and the GCC.




Ready to build the future with us? Upload your CV and join the movement where elite builders shape what‚Äôs next.




#RELYzIT #TechJobs #FreelanceTalent #Brussels #AIDatascience #MachineLearning #DeepLearning #Python #SQL #NLP #GenerativeAI
