Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
About Us

Zurich Insurance Company is a leading provider of insurance products and services, committed to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional customer service. Our ZCAM (Zurich Customer Active Management) team turns customer data into practical business solutions to drive the implementation of our ambitious customer strategy.

If you are a talented and experienced Full-Stack Developer, passionate about creating intuitive and engaging user interfaces and have a strong background in Angular and React, we would love to hear from you.

So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.

The opportunity: DATA SCIENTIST

Job Description

The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying advanced analytics solutions that power data-driven decisions across the Zurich organization. You will work with large-scale datasets, implement machine learning models in production environments, and leverage emerging AI technologies including LLMs to solve complex business problems. By combining technical excellence with business acumen, you'll help create a robust data foundation that drives innovation and growth.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and analytics solutions
Source, collect and analyse new data sources
Work closely with development teams to implement features into production
Work closely with business stakeholders to translate complex technical concepts into actionable business insights
Research, prototype, and implement emerging AI/ML technologies, particularly in generative AI and modern data science tools
Contribute to the development of data science roadmaps and architectural decisions for scalable analytics solutions


Requirements


University degree in physics, math, computer science or a related field
Professional experience in related role and/or demonstrated competency (projects) utilizing relevant technologies
Proficient in Python, Java or similar programming languages with experience building production systems.
Strong foundation in algorithms, data structures, object-oriented design, and software engineering best practices including version control, testing frameworks, and code documentation.
Experience in modelling and predictive analytics with experience working with unstructured data
Experience with machine learning tools in big data environments
Practical experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.), prompt engineering, and response optimization
Experience with SQL/NoSQL databases
Strong problem-solving skills, analytical mind and attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to explain technical issues to a non-technical audience
Prior experience in financial institutions (or other similar industries) is a plus
Strong proficiency in both English and Portuguese is required, Spanish language skills are a plus


Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

Title: Data Scientist / Applied Scientist (Mid and Senior Levels)
Description:
We are hiring multiple Data Scientists and Applied Scientists across LATAM to join the Microsoft 365 team. These are remote positions, allowing you to work from the comfort of your home!

As part of our team, you will help shape one of Microsoft‚Äôs fastest-growing cloud services. Your work will directly impact Copilot, enabling personalized, context-aware experiences that empower millions of users across Microsoft 365.

Do you want to collaborate closely with software engineers, product managers, and researchers to design, implement, and evaluate models and algorithms that continuously adapt and improve based on user interactions and feedback? Do you want to leverage advanced machine learning and information retrieval to predict and optimize memory content selection, representation, and lifecycle management.

You will work at the forefront of applied AI and machine learning, shaping the future of intelligent productivity tools. You will contribute to a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and experimentation.

About The Team

The Substrate Core Substrate team powers the infrastructure that underpins Microsoft 365‚Äôs most critical services and Copilot. We are a high-impact, forward-looking team focused on building intelligent, scalable, and cost-efficient platforms that enable Microsoft to deliver world-class productivity experiences to billions of users. Our mission is to drive operational excellence and innovation across the M365 fleet by leveraging AI, automation, and deep platform integration.

Your core mission will be to deliver exciting innovation in Microsoft Copilot. Microsoft Copilot is revolutionizing how people work and have created an unprecedented opportunity to advance the state-of-the-art in a way that benefits millions of people.

More About Your Responsibilities

We are seeking candidates with research skills and the desire to pursue the cutting edge in model development that pushes technological boundaries. We are looking for candidates with interest and experience in language model training, large language model evaluation, and quality assessment. In particular we would like a candidate that has a passion for understanding what makes an AI solution work and how to measure its performance.

We are looking for candidates who are creative, self-driven, curious, people-oriented and comfortable defining a path through ambiguity towards high-level goals. The successful applicants will collaborate closely with people across Microsoft‚Äôs product teams and Microsoft Research to see their ideas realized in products and services that are used worldwide, as well as to contribute back to the scientific community and beyond (e.g. via presentations, publications, media interviews, and similar). Come to define, design, and deliver what enterprise cloud productivity means.

As a Data Scientist / Applied Scientist, you will help transform how Copilot features are evaluated and improved. Your team will deliver end-to-end experimentation, evaluation, and insights to Copilot engineers, PMs, and fellow scientists. You‚Äôll work on the data generation platform that creates algorithms and ML pipelines for simulating user actions and datasets that reflect real-world usage and user preferences and develop metrics that go beyond accuracy ‚Äì capturing nuance, intent, and satisfaction. You‚Äôll work on scalable pipelines that support offline evaluations for Copilot Search, BizChat, Connectors, and Agents (DAs). This opportunity will allow you to dive deep into Copilot technologies, shape how AI quality is measured at scale, build critical skills in the AI-era, and rapidly grow your career.

By applying to this position, you will be considered for multiple similar positions within our organization for an invitation-only virtual interview day. Position specifics, including hiring team, location, and position details, will be determined following the interview process.

Responsibilities


Develop and evaluate ML models using prepared datasets, customer feedback, and novel training/fine-tuning algorithms for language models.
Write production-quality code, apply debugging best practices, and stay current with industry trends.
Drive customer-centric solutions by aligning with business goals and managing stakeholder expectations.
Collaborate cross-functionally to define success metrics and improve AI quality at scale.
Lead research projects that yield new algorithms, tools, or insights solving open problems.
Analyze evaluation outputs to identify gaps in coverage, quality, and usability.
Design experiments, define metrics, and develop ML pipelines for encoder-decoder and cross-encoder models, semantic search, and user intent understanding.
Work with large-scale data while championing privacy and compliance.
Engage with customers and internal teams to identify pain points and drive impactful improvements.
Stay engaged with the latest research and foster a strong applied science culture. Publishing is encouraged.


Qualifications

Main qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, or related field.
4+ years of experience in predictive analytics, statistics, or research.
Experience with synthetic data generation and data management for evaluation/training.
At least one year of experience publishing patents or peer-reviewed papers.
Deep motivation for user-centric AI and interest in human cognition, memory, and AI.
Global collaboration is integral to our work at Microsoft, and proficiency in English is essential for effective communication in this role.


Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, or related field.
Experience with large-scale embedding models and transformer architectures.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning and distributed computing platforms (e.g., Heron, AML, Euclid).
Proficient analytical skills and experience with telemetry and performance metrics.
DevOps experience and cloud services knowledge (Azure preferred).
Agile development experience and a structured approach to software design.


Interpersonal Skills


Growth mindset with resilience and a passion for learning.
Commitment to diversity, inclusion, and authentic collaboration.
Effective communication skills with the ability to engage diverse audiences.
Ownership mindset with the ability to deliver results and manage expectations.
Self-motivated and collaborative across teams and organizations.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

As part of our team, you will help shape one of Microsoft‚Äôs fastest-growing cloud services. Your work will directly impact Copilot, enabling personalized, context-aware experiences that empower millions of users across Microsoft 365.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Mo√´t Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities


Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.


Profile


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Preferably experience with Dataiku.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus


Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent
Show more

Title: Junior ML Engineer
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

Translated has been at the forefront of innovation in the language services industry, actively coordinating several European projects such as Matecat, MMT, Meetween. Through these leading AI research initiatives, Translated has collaborated with esteemed partners like FBK, Zoom Research, and Kites. These partnerships have concentrated on advancing state-of-the-art technology, steering the industry towards more efficient and intelligent solutions for machine translation and beyond.

We are looking for a Junior ML Engineer. As a Junior ML Engineer at Translated, you will contribute to deploying state-of-the-art models in production environments, converting research breakthroughs into practical solutions that enhance and expand our AI services. If you are passionate about making AI technology accessible and impactful, this position offers you the opportunity to make a meaningful impact.

What You‚Äôll Do


Deploy advanced machine learning models to address real-world challenges, transforming Translated's research from concept to reality and developing impactful AI-driven solutions.
Implement fast and scalable Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.
Introduce state-of-the-art techniques, tools, and architecture that improve the performance, latency, throughput, and efficiency of our model inference stack.
Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure they consistently provide value, directly impacting the role of AI in serving individuals and businesses.
Manage project lifecycle autonomously, from planning to deployment, with guidance from senior team members.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of machine learning researchers, engineers, product owners, designers and system administrators.
Participate in continuous learning opportunities to stay ahead in the fast-evolving field of AI and Machine Translation.


Requirements


Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in Java and Python.
Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
Some hands-on experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.
Have an understanding of modern LLM architectures and an intuition for how to optimize their performance, particularly for inference.
Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.
Ability to move quickly in an environment where things may be loosely defined with competing priorities or deadlines.
Enjoys owning problems end-to-end and is willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to complete the job.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the capacity to convey technical concepts to non-expert audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


2+ years industry/equivalent experience.
Experience in serving and optimizing LLMs inference processes.


We offer: full-time contract. This position requires daily in-office presence, so we are unable to accommodate fully remote work. However, we value flexibility and offer the opportunity to work up to 48 days remotely per year, allowing for a balanced and adaptable work experience.

Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 5 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits and Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing
Water aerobics
Fitness
Pilates
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks
Bonuses and incentives for employees who quit smoking, ride a bicycle to work, or adopt a child.


Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding.

Diversity Statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Privacy Policy

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries‚Äîhelping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies ‚Äì breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries‚Äîensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator‚Äôs top companies list ‚Äì all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum‚Äîbacked by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years‚Äîyou'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Summary

The Data Scientist is responsible for analyzing complex data to uncover valuable insights, build predictive models, and support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will work closely with various teams to design and implement models that drive business outcomes, optimize processes, and solve problems across departments such as Product, Marketing, and Operations. This role is integral to Deel‚Äôs data-driven culture, making it a core function within the company‚Äôs broader analytics and data strategy.

Responsibilities


Solve real world problems using applied algorithmic research and Data Science practices
Implement functionality which can be served in production for internal customers as well as external customers
Designing, building and maintaining data sets
Data cleaning
Feature engineering and extraction
Modeling
Experimentation
Online and offline demonstrations of capabilities
Building end-to-end machine learning pipelines
Conduct reproducible research
Collaborate with Engineering, Operations, Product Management and other functions in the company to deliver algorithmic solutions
Apply software engineering practices in our code that implements our research and its infrastructure
Produce high quality, clean, maintainable reproducible research and code


Qualifications


Background and experience in data/backend engineering, ideally in production environments (3+ years) (Mid/Senior Level role)
High proficiency in Python and its data science stack.
Background and hands-on experience (2+ years) in applied algorithmic research, specifically in information retrieval, text processing, computer vision (CV), computational linguistics (NLP) and machine learning
Track record of good written and verbal communication of complex things in a simple way as well as ability to collaborate well with people from different backgrounds and professions
A master‚Äôs degree or higher
Experience in NLP is a plus


Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you‚Äôll enjoy


Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

  • Implement functionality which can be served in production for internal customers as well as external customers
  • Designing, building and maintaining data sets
  • Data cleaning
  • Feature engineering and extraction
  • Modeling
  • Experimentation
  • Online and offline demonstrations of capabilities
  • Building end-to-end machine learning pipelines
  • Conduct reproducible research
  • Collaborate with Engineering, Operations, Product Management and other functions in the company to deliver algorithmic solutions
  • Apply software engineering practices in our code that implements our research and its infrastructure
  • Produce high quality, clean, maintainable reproducible research and code

Qualifications

  • Background and experience in data/backend engineering, ideally in production environments (3+ years) (Mid/Senior Level role)
  • High proficiency in Python and its data science stack.
  • Background and hands-on experience (2+ years) in applied algorithmic research, specifically in information retrieval, text processing, computer vision (CV), computational linguistics (NLP) and machine learning
  • Track record of good written and verbal communication of complex things in a simple way as well as ability to collaborate well with people from different backgrounds and professions
  • A master‚Äôs degree or higher
  • Experience in NLP is a plus

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you‚Äôll enjoy

  • Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
  • Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
  • The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the world‚Äôs #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We‚Äôre looking for a passionate AI Scientist to join the Translated team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. Our team is developing the next-generation Machine Translation System, with the ambitious goal of reaching the singularity that we define as the quality of the top-1% professional translator and making it available to millions of people worldwide.

What You‚Äôll Do


Product-driven research: apply the latest research to improve the quality of our Machine Translation solution and make an impact on our latest product.
Autonomously manage the full project lifecycle, from planning to deployment, providing key insights and technical directions.
Utilize an HPC cluster for scalable, multi-node training tasks to accelerate model development and quickly evaluate research ideas.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of product owners, designers, developers and system administrators.
Participate in continuous learning opportunities to stay ahead in the fast-evolving field of AI and Machine Translation.


Qualifications Required


MSc in machine learning or a related field and 3+ years of industry/research experience (a PhD is considered equivalent).
Proven experience in fine-tuning Large Language Models using distributed training frameworks and libraries (e.g., DeepSpeed, FSDP, Transformers).
Proficiency in Python and experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., PyTorch).
Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the capacity to convey technical concepts to non-expert audiences.
Ability to iterate quickly and make decisions based on results and data analytics.


Additional Preferred Qualifications


Experience developing Machine Translation models is a strong plus.
Experience with modern LLM alignment techniques, such as Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF), DPO, and GRPO.
Experience with job scheduling and workload management systems, particularly Slurm.


Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 7 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits and Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing, TRX, and Pilates classes
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks
Bonuses and incentives for employees who quit smoking or adopt a child.


Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding

Diversity statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Privacy Policy

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attivit√†: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualit√†, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilit√† e la sostenibilit√† al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica √® molto pi√π che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo che entrer√† a far parte del Dipartimento Operations & Technology come Data Scientist.




Principali attivit√†:

Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
Contribuire allo sviluppo e all‚Äôevoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidariet√†, pragmaticit√†, efficacia e affiatamento.
Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.




Requisiti:

Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell‚Äôelaborazione di dati e nell‚Äôapplicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).
Capacit√† di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn‚Ä¶
Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
Capacit√† di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacit√† di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Sono considerati requisiti preferenziali:

Conoscenza Databricks
Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
Conoscenza servizi Azure
Conoscenza Power BI
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli LLM open




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunit√† di lavorare nella pi√π grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle pi√π grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilit√† di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalit√† e responsabilit√† attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversit√†, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunit√† di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunit√† di lavoro ibrido;
Laptop aziendale;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (43k)




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunit√† e promuove diversit√† e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione. In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo. Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinch√© il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, et√†, etnia, nazionalit√†, disabilit√†, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.







******




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a profile to join the Operations & Technology Department as Data Scientist.




Main Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design, engineer, implement, and document new AI solutions to support business processes.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development and evolution of the Data Platform in terms of technological, organizational, and process aspects.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the growth of the company's data assets.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with other team members to foster a group organizational culture based on principles of solidarity, pragmatism, effectiveness, and teamwork.

‚Ä¢ Maintain, develop, and evolve models currently in production, assuming full management in collaboration with the team.

‚Ä¢ Design, implementation, industrialization, maintenance, and monitoring of machine learning pipelines and virtual agents capable of supporting the transformation of business processes.

‚Ä¢ Direct contact with internal customers to evaluate results and gather development requirements.




Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Degree or diploma in science/computer science/statistics, or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/machine learning models.

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of machine learning and AI algorithms (LLM, tree models, NLP, clustering, neural networks, time series, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data analysis and preprocessing mechanisms and feature engineering for machine learning projects (streaming and batch).

‚Ä¢ Coding and debugging skills in Pyspark and Python, and therefore knowledge of the main machine learning libraries and frameworks, especially Spark and MLib, as well as MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, etc.

‚Ä¢ Expertise in data modeling, statistical experiment modeling, and general knowledge of quantitative methods.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience designing, implementing, and industrializing integrated AI solutions.

‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze business problems, data, and context. Ability to perform hypothesis testing, model comparison, and result interpretation and validation.

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of English.




Preferred qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Databricks

‚Ä¢ Git for code versioning and basic devops

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Azure services

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Power BI

‚Ä¢ Experience using open LLMs




What you will find in Lottomatica:

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Company laptop;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience from 43K.




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Science
Description:
Aubay √® una societ√† leader in Europa nelle aree di consulenza direzionale e ICT, quotata sul mercato NYSE Euronext di Parigi.




La nostra proposta




Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Science Expert che, all‚Äôinterno del nostro Centro di Competenza Big Data, sar√† un punto di riferimento tecnico e metodologico in progetti complessi in ambito Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning e Natural Language Processing.




La persona sar√† riconosciuta come referente dai colleghi per le proprie competenze specialistiche, potr√† contribuire alla formazione e all‚Äôaggiornamento del team, oltre che alla gestione e al coordinamento di attivit√† progettuali.




In particolare, il/la candidato/a:




Analizzer√† i requisiti di business traducendoli in soluzioni AI scalabili.
Progetter√† e svilupper√† algoritmi avanzati di AI, ML e NLP, con focus su modelli di AI Generativa (Transformer, LLM, suite Mistral).
Utilizzer√† tool di sviluppo (Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, ecc.) e metodologie MLOps per garantire qualit√† e versionamento del codice.
Lavorer√† in team multidisciplinari in ottica Agile/SCRUM, contribuendo a deliverable strategici e complessi.
Garantir√† il rispetto di performance, tempi e standard qualitativi di progetto.




Requisiti richiesti




Oltre 10 anni di esperienza in contesti complessi di consulenza e data science.
Solida esperienza in analisi requisiti di business e progettazione algoritmi AI/ML/NLP.
Ottima conoscenza Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch e strumenti di AI Generativa.
Conoscenza metodologie MLOps, Git e strumenti di versionamento.
Esperienza con database relazionali e non relazionali.
Capacit√† di rappresentazione dati con strumenti come Power BI.
Conoscenza tecniche di data mining e statistica.
Abitudine a lavorare in contesti Agile/SCRUM.
Familiarit√† con AI Act, GDPR e linee guida etiche per l‚ÄôAI.




Competenze gradite




Esperienza nello sviluppo e utilizzo di API e tecnologie come Apache Kafka.
Conoscenza della piattaforma Domino.
Attitudine alla divulgazione e condivisione del know-how all‚Äôinterno del team.




Modalit√† operativa




Attivit√† in modalit√† ibrida (Roma) con disponibilit√† a trasferte.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise. You will combine IT, mathematics, statistics and business knowledge to create predictive analyses, which you will present and communicate in a professional and skilful manner. You will work in a technology-driven environment, focusing on the development of end-to-end Artificial Intelligence solutions, with particular emphasis on the application of Large Language Models and AI Agents. We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and analyze data.

Specifically, within a structured team, you will deal with:


Analyzing business cases and translating them into Artificial Intelligence solutions;
Designing the solution from both technical and technological perspectives;
Designing and implementing the solution with a focus on Artificial Intelligence techniques;
Validating the implemented solution with business experts;
Analyzing, designing, and implementing monitoring tools for the developed solutions;
Supporting the launch and managing the maintenance of the applications.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This opportunity is perfect for you if:


You hold a degree in Economics, Mathematics, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Computer Engineering, Management Engineering, or Computer Science;
You have developed the ability to combine business knowledge with IT skills, including basic modeling and data exploration;
You are familiar with programming languages used in data analysis, particularly Python;
You have skills in statistics and machine learning models;
You have a basic understanding of major Artificial Intelligence solutions;
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.


Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
MF Consultant

MF Consultant - societ√† di servizi HR alle aziende. Esperti di Head Hunting & Executive Search; Talent Acquisition Outsourching e RPO, Temporary Manager e Coaching & Mentoring, ricerca per importante azienda cliente nel settore dell' intrattenimento un Data Scientist su Roma.

Principali Attivit√†


Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
Contribuire allo sviluppo e all'evoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidariet√†, pragmaticit√†, efficacia e affiatamento.
Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.


Requisiti


Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell'elaborazione di dati e nell'applicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).
Capacit√† di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn...
Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
Capacit√† di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacit√† di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Sono Considerati Requisiti Preferenziali


Conoscenza Databricks
Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
Conoscenza servizi Azure
Conoscenza Power BI
Esperienza nell'utilizzo degli LLM open

HEADHUNTING & EXECUTIVE SEARCH: Seguiamo le selezioni di Top manager, Middle manager, Key Resources, Coordinator provenienti da differenti settori e con esperienze nazionali e internazionali.
TALENT ACQUISITION OUTSOURCING & RPO: La nostra forza sta nella mappatura delle competenze e creazione di JD con intervista strutturata al management, applichiamo tecniche e strumenti personalizzati di ricerca del profilo ideale; Il nostro must √® il rispetto delle singole pari e la governance dei tempi e del budget che ci vengono affidati.
SERVIZI DI CONSULENZA HR TEMPORARY: I nostri HR Consultant aiutano l'impresa a gestire il personale in ogni ambito e processo della vita aziendale. Analizziamo tutti i processi relativi alla gestione e allo sviluppo delle risorse umane, a partire dal Recruitment, passando per l'Onboarding, per la Pianificazione e il Monitoraggio delle Performance. Siamo anche esperti di Training, Counseling, Professional & Business Coaching; Evaluation, Talent e Performance Management; Diversity & Inclusion, Internal Communication; Brand Identity e Web Reputation; Employer Branding ma anche di Offboarding
LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT: Una persona valorizzata nelle proprie capacit√† personali e professionali sar√† pi√π motivata anche nel proprio lavoro, offrendo all'intera organizzazione un valore aggiunto. La mission dei nostri corsi √® di creare team forti e coesi in cui ciascun componente sia in grado di lavorare insieme e in modo autonomo valorizzando l'Unicit√† del singolo e la sua integrazione nel gruppo. La nostra offerta formativa pu√≤ essere modulata e costruita sulle esigenze delle persone e dell'organizzazione: Formazione finanziata; Formazione manageriale e soft skill; Percorsi di professional & business coaching; Counseling aziendale e team building.


MF Consultant sostiene da sempre il talento delle persone; si impegna, pertanto, a promuovere un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo.

  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.

Sono Considerati Requisiti Preferenziali

  • Conoscenza Databricks
  • Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
  • Conoscenza servizi Azure
  • Conoscenza Power BI
  • Esperienza nell'utilizzo degli LLM open

Se la descrizione delle responsabilit√† e delle competenze descritte si allineano al tuo percorso professionale e ritieni di essere interessat* all'opportunit√† candidati inviando il tuo CV alla mail marianna@mfconsultant.it.

Grazie per il tuo tempo!

CANDIDATI PER AVERE MAGGIORI INFORMAZIONI!!!

A proposito di noi!

MF Consultant √® Nata Nel 2015, Nel Tempo √® Cresciuta Grazie Al Duro Lavoro Di Professionisti Che Si Sono Sempre Distinti Per Ambizione e Passione, Uniti Da Un Grande Senso Di Rispetto Per Il Valore Umano Delle Risorse Aziendali.   • HEADHUNTING & EXECUTIVE SEARCH: Seguiamo le selezioni di Top manager, Middle manager, Key Resources, Coordinator provenienti da differenti settori e con esperienze nazionali e internazionali.
  • TALENT ACQUISITION OUTSOURCING & RPO: La nostra forza sta nella mappatura delle competenze e creazione di JD con intervista strutturata al management, applichiamo tecniche e strumenti personalizzati di ricerca del profilo ideale; Il nostro must √® il rispetto delle singole pari e la governance dei tempi e del budget che ci vengono affidati.

Analizziamo tutti i processi relativi alla gestione e allo sviluppo delle risorse umane, a partire dal Recruitment, passando per l'Onboarding, per la Pianificazione e il Monitoraggio delle Performance. Siamo anche esperti di Training, Counseling, Professional & Business Coaching; Evaluation, Talent e Performance Management; Diversity & Inclusion, Internal Communication; Brand Identity e Web Reputation; Employer Branding ma anche di Offboarding
  • LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT: Una persona valorizzata nelle proprie capacit√† personali e professionali sar√† pi√π motivata anche nel proprio lavoro, offrendo all'intera organizzazione un valore aggiunto. Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Il Gruppo EIES, composto da Energent, I&M, Enway e Skienda √® una realt√† di consulenza e di prodotto consolidata nel mercato delle soluzioni e dei servizi ICT.

Per ampliamento dell‚Äôorganico ricerchiamo la figura di un Data Scientist.

Competenze Richieste

  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza lavorativa;
  • Buona conoscenza di Python;
  • NLP;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di Knime.

Cosa Offriamo

  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico ed orientato alla crescita professionale;
  • Percorsi di formazione e certificazione;
  • Buoni pasto;
  • Piattaforma di e-commerce con scontistiche riservate ai dipendenti;
  • Confronto all'interno di un team strutturato e coeso;
  • Inquadramento contrattuale e retributivo commisurato alla Seniority;
  • Programma di Buddy: un collega dedicato che ti affiancher√† nel periodo iniziale per facilitare l'integrazione nel team e supportarti nell'apprendimento dei processi aziendali;
  • Welfare aziendale.

Sede di lavoro: Roma

Modalit√† di lavoro: Remoto

Chi siamo?

Il Gruppo EIES rappresenta l'alleanza strategica di quattro aziende italiane leader nel settore informatico, unite per offrire al mercato una copertura completa, integrata e sinergica.

Composto da Energent, I&M Consulting, Enway e Skienda, il Gruppo √® una realt√† che eroga consulenza, progettualit√† e servizi in ambito ICT, fornendo soluzioni ad alto valore aggiunto per i propri clienti. Con sedi a Roma, Napoli e Milano, operiamo in settori come Finance, Insurance, Telco, Energy e Pubblica Amministrazione, collaborando con aziende di primaria importanza ed i principali System Integrator.

Il gruppo √® organizzato in practices tematiche afferenti a diverse aree di competenza: Infrastrutture & Security, Application Modernization & Cloud Transformation, Data Science e Artificial Intelligence e Consulting. Inoltre, il Gruppo dispone di due Factory specializzate in Sviluppo Software e Dati che lavorano sinergicamente per progettare soluzioni innovative, affidabili e personalizzate e per la delivery di progetti chiavi in mano.

Unirsi al Gruppo EIES significa entrare a far parte di una realt√† dinamica e all'avanguardia, dove il contributo di ciascuno viene valorizzato e l'innovazione √® al centro di ci√≤ che facciamo. Se cerchi una sfida stimolante in un ambiente in continua evoluzione, il nostro gruppo √® il posto giusto per te.

Il presente annuncio √® rivolto a entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ali Professional, divisione IT&Digital √® alla ricerca di un Data Scientist per importante azienda cliente.

Ruolo: Ti occuperai dello sviluppo di soluzioni di intelligenza artificiale e machine learning applicate ai dati di Osservazione della Terra, lavorando su pipeline analitiche che trasformano immagini satellitari in informazioni utili per clienti pubblici e privati. Collaborerai con ingegneri e product manager per integrare i casi d‚Äôuso reali nella roadmap della piattaforma e sviluppare servizi scalabili.

Il nostro stack comprende Python, librerie di AI/ML (PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow), strumenti geospaziali e ambienti cloud come GCP, ma restiamo sempre aperti all‚Äôadozione di nuove tecnologie, in un‚Äôottica di miglioramento continuo guidato dalla ricerca e sviluppo.




Responsabilit√† principali

Sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML applicate a dati geospaziali e satellitari.
Collaborare con il team di prodotto per trasformare i casi d‚Äôuso in funzionalit√† di piattaforma.
Progettare pipeline di machine learning partendo da dati strutturati e non strutturati.
Ricercare e applicare algoritmi di deep learning e computer vision ai dati di telerilevamento.
Supportare il deployment e il monitoraggio di modelli predittivi in ambienti cloud.




Requisiti

Problem solving: affronti problemi complessi con metodo, spirito critico e attenzione ai dettagli.
Determinazione: sei ambizioso/a, proattivo/a e mantieni alti standard di qualit√†.
Spirito di squadra: collabori con trasparenza, condividi idee e sostieni i colleghi.
Competenze tecniche: esperienza in data mining, analisi e modellazione con linguaggi come Python, SQL o Java. Padronanza di framework ML (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, ecc.) e versionamento del codice (Git).
Formazione: laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria o discipline affini.
Lingua: ottima conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese scritto e parlato.




Costituiscono un plus

Esperienza con dati satellitari e metodi GIS.
Conoscenza di ambienti cloud (es. GCP) e piattaforme container (Docker).
Esperienza nel monitoraggio e nella messa in produzione di modelli predittivi.
Familiarit√† con strumenti per il calcolo distribuito (Dask, Ray).




Cosa si offre

Team di talento e altamente motivati, impegnati in progetti ad alto impatto.
Opportunit√† di crescita eccezionali, con possibilit√† di guidare iniziative rilevanti.
Benefit: orari flessibili, hybrid working, supporto alla crescita professionale e retribuzione commisurata all‚Äôimpatto e al valore che porti al team.




Valorizziamo la diversit√† di background ed esperienze. Se ti appassiona questo ruolo e pensi di poter dare un contributo, ti invitiamo a candidarti anche se non soddisfi ogni singolo requisito!




L'azienda garantisce le pari opportunit√† e accoglie candidature senza distinzione di sesso, et√†, razza, religione, orientamento sessuale, disabilit√† o altre caratteristiche protette dalla legge.

Title: Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Credit Risk & Fraud Analytics
Description:
Company Description

Ready to make a difference? Experian has evolved into a global tech company and specialized in data and analytics. We're passionate about unlocking the power of data to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We're a member of the FTSE 30 and for more than 125 years we've helped economies and communities flourish ‚Äì and we're not done.

Discover the Unexpected - Our 22k amazing employees in 30+ countries believe the possibilities for you, and the world, are growing. We're investing in the future, through new technologies, experienced people and new ideas so we can help create a better tomorrow. To do this we employ 'big-thinkers' that share our purpose #uniquelyexperian

Job Description

Join Experian Italy's fast-growing, Data Science team, where innovation meets real-world impact. We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Scientist or Senior Data Scientist to develop and provide the latest analytical solutions that empower smarter decisions ‚Äî especially in the financial services sector.

What You'll Do

As a necessary member of our team, you will contribute to the design and deployment of machine learning models and data-driven strategies that address real-world challenges in credit risk, fraud detection, and customer intelligence. You will report to the Southern Europe Analytics Director.

Your Responsibilities


Develop, and validate predictive models using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques.
Translate complex data into relevant insights and communicate them to clients and team members.
Collaborate with teams to understand needs and shape tailored data science solutions.
Contribute to pre-sales efforts by showcasing our analytics capabilities and customizing solutions for client needs.
(For senior candidates) Lead projects and mentor junior team members.


Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward and recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work‚Ñ¢ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Qualifications


2+ years of experience in data science in credit risk, fraud analytics, or marketing analytics.
Background in machine learning, predictive modeling, and statistical analysis.
Proficiency with tools such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., Databricks, Cloudera, and Snowflake).
Proficiency in English (written and spoken).
(For senior candidates) ability to manage projects and lead teams.


Good to have


Knowledge or hands-on experience with Generative AI concepts, including LLMs, RAG, prompt engineering, and information retrieval.
Familiarity with credit-related topics (e.g., issuing, monitoring, Bureau data) and regulatory analytics frameworks (‚ÄúBasel‚Äù, IFRS 9).


Why Join Us?


Work on impactful projects that shape the future of financial decision-making.
Be part of a collaborative,, and diverse team.
Enjoy a flexible hybrid work environment.
Great compensation package, bonus plan, and comprehensive benefits:
Health insurance
Lunch vouchers
Wellness perks
Career development opportunities


Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward and recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
All‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôarea Strategy, Business Development & Wholebuy Office ‚Äì Competence Development, con sede a Roma, stiamo cercando una persona da inserire nel ruolo di Machine Learning Engineer con la passione per la tecnologia e l‚Äôinnovazione e la voglia di giocare un ruolo da protagonista nella trasformazione digitale.

Se ami le sfide, lavori con un mindset data-driven e vuoi contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti su Google Cloud Platform (GCP), potresti essere la persona che fa per noi.

Chi stiamo cercando

Una persona con esperienza nella progettazione, sviluppo e gestione di applicazioni di data science in ambienti cloud, capace di coniugare:


competenze di sviluppo software,
gestione dell‚Äôinfrastruttura cloud,
automazione dei processi di deployment.


Lavorerai a stretto contatto con Data Scientist, Data Analyst e colleghi ITC per creare soluzioni avanzate a supporto dei processi aziendali.

Cosa farai


Industrializzerai soluzioni di Data Science e ML, curando orchestrazione, ambienti, codice e pipeline CI/CD
Scriverai codice efficiente, riutilizzabile e in linea con le best practice di ML Governance
Collaborerai in team cross-funzionali, contribuendo attivamente alla progettazione di architetture cloud evolute
Promuoverai l‚Äôadozione di pratiche MLOps per aumentare l'efficienza e l'affidabilit√† dei nostri progetti
Integrerai modelli predittivi nelle applicazioni cloud, migliorandone performance e scalabilit√†


Quali sono le competenze chiave


Ottima conoscenza di Python e dei principali framework: Spark (PySpark), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas
Esperienza con strumenti DevOps: CI/CD, Git, Cloud Build
Familiarit√† con container e MLOps: Docker, librerie e framework specifici
Capacit√† di creare e gestire API, strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Looker
Conoscenza ambienti Linux e scripting Bash
Background solido in software engineering
Esperienza pratica con i servizi GCP: BigQuery, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Vertex AI, ecc.
Formazione tecnico-quantitativa


Cosa offriamo


Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Formazione continua e percorsi di crescita professionale
L‚Äôinserimento in un team giovane, dinamico e con forte orientamento all‚Äôinnovazione
La partecipazione a progetti strategici e stimolanti in un contesto ad alta evoluzione tecnologica


Tale attivit√† verr√† svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Pronto a costruire il futuro con noi? Candidati ora e unisciti al nostro team!

Title: BNL BNP Paribas ‚Äì Data Scientist
Description:

lo sviluppo di nuovi casi d‚Äôuso di Intelligenza Artificiale anche generativa
realizzando e manutenendo le piattaforme applicative di riferimento
programmi di formazione specifici e animando la community dei Data Scientist

assicura, in coerenza con le linee guida del Gruppo, il coordinamento del Framework Data Protection (GDPR) al fine di definire i processi Privacy end-to-end in ottica Privacy by Design;

Possiede ottime capacit√† analitiche

Title: DATA SCIENTIST ANALYST - PMO
HTML:
Job Description

Il Gruppo Aeroporti di Roma, nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit Aviation nell‚Äôunit√† Operation & Maintenance, in particolare nell‚Äôasset ‚ÄúO&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations‚Äù √® alla ricerca di:

Data scientist analyst

L‚Äôasset O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations si occupa principalmente di garantire la progettazione, l‚Äôimplementazione e l‚Äôintegrazione di soluzioni IoT per la gestione degli asset, ingegnerizzando e analizzando i dati al fine di abilitare l‚Äôevoluzione della strategia manutentiva degli asset in ottica di value for money.

La risorsa avr√† maturato un‚Äôesperienza di 3 ‚Äì 5 anni in area automation presso realt√† industriali preferibilmente del settore trasporti/alimentare/beverage/pharma/automotive o presso societ√† impiantistiche costruttrici.

Sar√† considerato un plus l‚Äôaver maturato esperienza nell‚Äôambito di Data Science, Machine Learning o Software Engineering, preferibilmente in strutture di AI e Data analytics all‚Äôinterno di aziende a forte componente industriale/operativa o in aziende di consulenza che hanno sviluppato progetti relativi ai sopracitati ambiti.

Principali attivit√† e aree di responsabilit√†

  • Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalit√† di piattaforme di monitoraggio/SCADA di asset e impianti aeroportuali, automatizzando il processo di gestione dei dati e definendo la tipologia di dati da monitorare;
  • Collaborare attivamente per progettare e concepire nuove sensorizzazioni;
  • Definire, sviluppare e implementare i flussi di dati provenienti dai diversi asset e impianti aeroportuali, assicurando che i dati siano strutturati in modo coerente con le esigenze tecnico/manutentive e pronti per essere analizzati;
  • Integrare nuove fonti di dati nei sistemi esistenti, collaborando con fornitori e strutture tecniche per l‚Äôimplementazione delle soluzioni identificate;
  • Definire e implementare le politiche di data governance, tra cui la definizione di standard di qualit√† dei dati e le linee guida di storicizzazione;
  • Collaborare con i team di data science, data analysis e altri stakeholder aziendali per comprendere le esigenze di dati utili a sviluppare modelli di Machine Learning/AI.

Requisiti Ed Esperienze

  • Conoscenza pratica di PLC, DCS, SCADA, MES e problematiche relative allo scambio di segnali tra differenti sistemi di automazione;
  • Esperienza con protocolli IoT: LoRaWAN, Zigbee, MQTT, OPC-UA per gestione e trasmissione dati sensoriali;
  • Esperienza con protocolli di comunicazione industriale: PROFINET, PROFIBUS, KNX, BACnet, Modbus, Ethernet/IP, CANopen, EtherCAT;
  • Esperienza con sensori e trasduttori per acquisizione dati (temperatura, umidit√†, pressione, accelerometri, giroscopi, vibrazionali, celle di carico, rogowski, sensori RFID/NFC);
  • Conoscenza di calibrazione, condizionamento segnali e interfacciamento con sistemi di acquisizione dati;
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di board IoT con Raspberry Pi, Arduino, STM32 per applicazioni industriali, monitoraggio remoto, automazione e integrazione sensori;
  • Esperienza in process control, automazione, comunicazione machine-to-machine, machine-to-system e soluzioni Internet of Things (IOT);
  • Comprensione delle strutture dati, della modellazione dei dati e dell'architettura software;
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione C, C++, VB.NET, SQL, Python;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
  • Esperienza con i flussi di lavoro basati sui dati (importazione, pulizia, funzionalit√†);

Competenze

  • Capacit√† di analisi e sintesi;
  • Pianificazione e organizzazione del lavoro;
  • Problem Solving;
  • Teamwork;
  • Orientamento al risultato.

Titolo Di Studi

  • Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria dell‚Äôautomazione, Ingegneria informatica, Ingegneria elettronica, Ingegneria elettrica.
  • Sar√† considerato titolo preferenziale l‚Äôaver partecipato ad un master/corso di formazione in AI, Machine Learning, con particolare focus sull'integrazione delle tecnologie IoT nei processi di automazione e nella gestione dei sistemi industriali intelligenti, inclusi i sistemi di monitoraggio e controllo avanzato.

Sede Di Lavoro

Fiumicino Aeroporto

Tipologia Di Offerta

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato;
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida.

La selezione √® rivolta ad entrambi i sessi nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006.

Offerta di lavoro tutelata dalla L. 68/99 ‚Äì Categorie protette.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Space Engineer
Description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure & Defend, Observe & Protect, Explore, Travel & Navigate.

Artificial Intelligence Engineering

CANDIDATES THAT WOULD IMPRESS US

PROFILE:

You graduated from an Engineering School with a master‚Äôs degree ‚Äì a PhD is a plus

Your level of experience ranges from junior to advance: you are a student OR/AND you have already occupied one or more positions among the following: Algorithm or Software Engineer, Artificial Intelligence Engineer

You are curious and willing to stay abreast of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

You enjoy thinking "outside the box" and use your creativity to address complex challenges

You are recognised as a team player and promote collaborative work

You are user centric and want to design components accordingly

COMPETENCIES:

You have in-depth knowledge in mathematics, algorithms, experiment plan, continuous iterations and Agility

You are proficient in one of the following Artificial Intelligence Approches:

Data driven AI, Symbolic AI, Hybrid AI on the Solution

Symbolic Artificial Intelligence and reasoning

Human/machine dialog

Systems Analysis

You understand the norms, laws and standards

You have knowledge of cybersecurity

You can confidently discuss with people from different jobs and background

You master foundational concepts in mathematics/ statistics science and their application to deploy them on Solution studies: statistical modelling, linear algebra, optimisation, machine learning Mathematics and Statistics

NICE TO HAVE:


Working heritage on major satellite Earth Observation and Navigation systems
Simulation by tool such as Matlab & Simulink
adopting modern Agile and DevOps processes
Knowledge of Data analysis and big data technologies
Knowledge of Cloud technologies and architectures
Knowledge of Edgetechnologies
Knowledge of object programming in particular Python (Pyorch) , Java, C ++ and relevant Data Science packages (such as numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas...);
Good knowledge of operating systems;



LIFE AS A THALES ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ENGINEERING ROLE

As an Artificial Intelligence Engineering Role within Thales, you will:

Design and develop trustworthy artificial intelligence components for various domains

Identify the right cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence technologies (machine learning, symbolic AI, dialogue) and develop the Artificial Intelligence component accordingly

Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU), and also to design multimodal approaches for Human-Machin Dialog including intention understanding, reasoning and hybrid AI

Work on Machine Learning, causality vs. correlation, and/or other Data driven AI technics such as Random Forest, Evolutionary Algorithms, ‚Ä¶

Work on Symbolic AI, Ontology, Semantic Web, Knowledge based Reasoning, Meta-heuristics, Problem Solving, Operations Research, Decision Making and reasoning

Propose and design approach alternatives

Integrate scientific method into engineering system methodology

Ensure data knowledge and traceability

Ensure continuous technowatch and be aware of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

Define the system capabilities thanks to a functional, logical and value analysis, describing functions to be performed to meet the real needs of the user in the various scenarii and maximising product value for Customer

YOUR CAREER AT THALES

Future opportunities will allow you to discover other domains or sites. You will be able to evolve and grow your competences in different areas:

Room and attention to personal development

Build your talents in another domain of Thales Group, discovering new products, new customers, new country or go to a more complex Solution

Choose between a technical expertise or a leadership path

Build an international career within a leading Engineering Group

At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth #SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!
